intro: Gossypium quinacre, commonly known as the wild cotton plant, is a species of flowering plant in the mallow family. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its soft, fluffy fibers that are harvested for textile production. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or purple. Gossypium quinacre plays an important role in both ecological systems and traditional textile industries.
